page.title: 06N.E.L.P.
page.content: N.E.L.P. stands for North-east London Polytechnic. We visited the Barking precinct; there are two other precincts, one in West Ham and the other in Stratford. The Barking site was built in 1930 as South-east Essex Technical College. In 1970 it was renamed North-east London Polytechnic. There are about 5,000 students here and about 550 tutors. To get in you have to get about 5 'O'levels and 2 'A'levels. There are lots of facilities like a swimming pool, a gym, lots of computers, squash courts and seven libraries. The librarian said there are about 300,000 books there.
